alert.note: Alert for Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 10:26AM EST until February 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Stark, Summit and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1023 AM EST, Trained weather spotters reported light rain and snowmelt causing minor flooding of poor drainage areas and low lying roads in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Akron, Canton, Wooster, Massillon, Barberton, Green, Alliance, Tallmadge, North Canton, Louisville, Orrville, Rittman, Mogadore, Minerva, Doylestown, Hartville, Creston, Brewster, Navarre and Dalton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
